pages.title: Wait. You're HOT?
pages.text: $(bold)How.$()$(br2)The sun has abandoned you. The oceans are frozen. The atmosphere is collapsing. And you — $(italic)you$() — have somehow managed to give yourself $(bold)heat stroke.$()$(br2)The ORSA Wellness Division did not prepare a pamphlet for this. We are improvising.$(br2)$(italic)This document is brought to you by the same people who told you "just build more heaters." We accept no liability.$()

pages.title: How Did We Get Here?
pages.text: Heat sources $(bold)stack$() in Frozen Dawn. Every heater, campfire, lava pool, and geothermal core near you adds its warmth together.$(br2)One heater? Cozy.$(br)Two heaters? Toasty.$(br)Eight diamond heaters? $(bold)You are an oven.$()$(br2)The temperature HUD in the top-left will tell you exactly how badly you've miscalculated. If the number is red and has three digits, you may want to reconsider your life choices.

pages.title: Stage 1: "Am I... Sweating?"
pages.text: At $(bold)60°C+$(), your body is confused. It spent all week freezing and now it's being slow-roasted.$(br2)$(li)$(bold)Weakness I$() — Your attacks are weaker$(li)No damage yet$(li)Action bar: "You're sweating... in a frozen apocalypse. Really?"$(br2)The screen tints slightly orange. This is the game judging you.$(br2)$(italic)ORSA Tip: This is a sign to stop. You will not stop. We know.$()

pages.title: Stage 2: "This Was a Mistake"
pages.text: At $(bold)90°C+$(), you have crossed from "warm" into "medium-rare."$(br2)$(li)$(bold)Weakness II$() — Much weaker$(li)$(bold)1 heart of damage$() every 2 seconds$(li)Action bar: "The heat is unbearable! Maybe fewer heaters?"$(br2)Fun fact: 90°C is the temperature at which you poach an egg. You are now the egg.$(br2)$(italic)The orange overlay is getting worse. Those are sweat drips. Yes, really.$()

pages.title: Stage 3: "I Am Cooked"
pages.text: At $(bold)120°C+$(), congratulations — you have achieved the internal temperature of a sous vide steak.$(br2)$(li)$(bold)Nausea$() — Your vision swims$(li)$(bold)Slowness II$() — Can barely move$(li)$(bold)2 hearts of damage$() every 2 seconds$(li)Action bar: "You are literally cooking alive. In an ice age."$(br2)You survived the death of the sun, the freezing of the oceans, and the collapse of the atmosphere — only to be done in by your own heating infrastructure. Poetic, really.

pages.title: The Armor Problem
pages.text: Here's the cruel part: your $(bold)insulated armor$() — the gear keeping you alive in the cold — also $(bold)traps heat.$()$(br2)Insulated clothing adds $(bold)+20%$() heat above 20°C.$(br)Heated armor adds $(bold)+40%$() heat above 20°C.$(br)EVA suit adds only $(bold)+8%$() (it has proper cooling).$(br2)So that cozy 80°C room? In heated armor, it's $(bold)104°C.$() You are a walking slow cooker.$(br2)$(italic)ORSA Engineering would like to remind you that the armor was designed for cold. Not for standing inside a furnace.$()

pages.title: How to Not Die (of Heat)
pages.text: $(bold)Step 1:$() Remove heaters. Yes, the ones you spent all game building. Remove some of them.$(br2)$(bold)Step 2:$() Spread them out. Heat stacks, so cluster = death sauna.$(br2)$(bold)Step 3:$() Take off the armor indoors. You don't need heated insulation next to four heaters.$(br2)$(bold)Step 4:$() Do not, under any circumstances, stand between a Geothermal Core and four Diamond Thermal Heaters. Kevin from Accounting tried this. He sends his regards from the burn ward on Mars.$()
